00006 #include <map>
00007 #include <stdio.h>
00008 
00009 class DInstanceCounter{
00010 public:
00011   static void addInstance(const char *stClassName);
00012   static void removeInstance(const char *stClassName);
00013   static void report();
00014   static void cleanup();
00015   static int numUnfreedInstances();
00016 private:
00017 //   /* the lstr struct is copied from an example on SGI's stl documentation page
00018 //      URL: http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/Map.html.  It provides the comparison.*/
00019 //   struct lstr{
00020 //     bool operator()(const char* s1, const char* s2) const{
00021 //       return strcmp(s1,s2) < 0;
00022 //     }
00023 //   };
00024 
00025   static std::map<const char*, int/*, lstr*/> mapNumConstructed;
00026   static std::map<const char*, int/*, lstr*/> mapNumDestructed;
00027 };
00028 
00029 
00030 // #ifdef DEBUG
00031 #if 0 //I disabled this class because it is not thread-safe
00032 inline void DInstanceCounter::addInstance(const char *stClassName){
00033   std::map<const char*, int/*, lstr*/>::iterator iter;
00034   int numInstances = 0;
00035 
00036   iter = mapNumConstructed.find(stClassName);
00037   if(iter != mapNumConstructed.end()){
00038     numInstances = (*iter).second;
00039   }
00040   else{
00041     mapNumDestructed[stClassName] = 0;
00042   }
00043   
00044   mapNumConstructed[stClassName] = numInstances+1;
00045 }
00046 
00047 inline void DInstanceCounter::removeInstance(const char *stClassName){
00048   std::map<const char*, int/*, DInstanceCounter::lstr*/>::iterator iter;
00049   int numInstances = 0;
00050   iter = mapNumDestructed.find(stClassName);
00051   if(iter == mapNumDestructed.end()){
00052     fprintf(stderr, "DInstanceCounter::removeInstance() couldn't find '%s'\n",
00053       stClassName);
00054     return;
00055   }
00056   numInstances = (*iter).second;
00057   mapNumDestructed[stClassName] = numInstances+1;
00058 }
00059 
00060 inline void DInstanceCounter::report(){
00061   std::map<const char*, int/*, lstr*/>::iterator iter1;
00062   std::map<const char*, int/*, lstr*/>::iterator iter2;
00063 
00064   iter1 = mapNumConstructed.begin();
00065   iter2 = mapNumDestructed.begin();
00066 
00067   fprintf(stderr, "------DInstanceCounter::report():\n");
00068   while(iter1 != mapNumConstructed.end()){
00069     fprintf(stderr,"  %s: constructed=%d destructed=%d current=%d\n",
00070       (*iter1).first, (*iter1).second, (*iter2).second,
00071       ((*iter1).second-(*iter2).second));
00072     ++iter1;
00073     ++iter2;
00074   }
00075 }
00076 
00077 inline int DInstanceCounter::numUnfreedInstances(){
00078   int retVal = 0;
00079   std::map<const char*, int/*, DInstanceCounter::lstr*/>::iterator iter1;
00080   std::map<const char*, int/*, DInstanceCounter::lstr*/>::iterator iter2;
00081 
00082   iter1 = mapNumConstructed.begin();
00083   iter2 = mapNumDestructed.begin();
00084 
00085   while(iter1 != mapNumConstructed.end()){
00086     retVal += ((*iter1).second-(*iter2).second);
00087     ++iter1;
00088     ++iter2;
00089   }
00090   return retVal;
00091 }
00092 #else /* make the funtions NO-OPS when not compiling debug so it's not slow*/
00093 inline void DInstanceCounter::addInstance(const char *stClassName){
00094   (void)stClassName; // NOOP - avoid compiler warning for unused parameter
00095 }
00096 inline void DInstanceCounter::removeInstance(const char *stClassName){
00097   (void)stClassName; // NOOP - avoid compiler warning for unused parameter
00098 }
00099 inline void DInstanceCounter::report(){
00100   fprintf(stderr, "DInstanceCounter::report() called from non-debug code!\n");
00101 }

00103   fprintf(stderr, "DInstanceCounter::numUnfreedInstances() called from "

00105   return 0;
